Package remodel.io

Class ExpressionCompiler

java.lang.Object
remodel.io.AbstractCompiler
remodel.io.SymbolCompiler
remodel.io.ExpressionCompiler
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor, remodel.io.TokenCodes
public abstract class ExpressionCompiler
extends remodel.io.SymbolCompiler
implements remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor
ExpressionCompiler is an abstract cross-compiler that translates ReMoDeL expressions into equivalent Java expressions. ExpressionCompiler is used to compile the body code of each Operation or Rule. It inherits from SymbolCompiler which translates ReMoDeL names into equivalent Java names.

ExpressionCompiler fulfils the role of a visitor in the Visitor Design Pattern, by virtue of implementing the ExpressionVisitor interface. Expression nodes in the parse-tree are visited by this ExpressionCompiler, and reciprocally invoke the appropriate writing method for the type of node.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Anthony J H Simons

  • Constructor Details

    • ExpressionCompiler

      public ExpressionCompiler​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Creates an ExpressionCompiler writing to a file, using the default UTF-8 character encoding. Creates a buffering ModelStreamer, writing to the file with the UTF-8 encoding.
      Parameters:
      file - the output file.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be opened.

    • ExpressionCompiler

      public ExpressionCompiler​(java.io.File file, java.lang.String encoding) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
      Creates an ExpressionCompiler writing to a file, using the specified character encoding. Recognised encodings include UTF-8, UTF-16, ISO-8859-1 (Latin-1) and others. Creates a buffering ModelStreamer, writing to the file with the given encoding.
      Parameters:
      file - the output file.
      encoding - the name of the character encoding.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be opened.
      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the encoding is not supported.

  • Method Details

    • writeIdentifierExpression

      public void writeIdentifierExpression​(remodel.expr.IdentifierExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of an identifier. Writes an identifier of the same name, unless the ReMoDeL identifier is "self". In this case, writes "this", unless the scope is within an inner class. In this case, prefixes "this" by the name of the outer type.
      Specified by:
      writeIdentifierExpression in interface remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor
      Parameters:
      expression - the IdentifierExpression.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeLiteralExpression

      public void writeLiteralExpression​(remodel.expr.LiteralExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of a literal value. Writes the value-text directly, unless this is a Character, in which case it is enclosed in single quotes, or a String, in which case it is enclosed in double quotes. Integer, Decimal, Boolean and Null values may be written directly.
      Specified by:
      writeLiteralExpression in interface remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor
      Parameters:
      expression - the LiteralExpression.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeUnaryExpression

      public void writeUnaryExpression​(remodel.expr.UnaryExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of a unary expression. Writes the Java translation of the unary operator, followed by the Java translation of the operand expression.
      Specified by:
      writeUnaryExpression in interface remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor
      Parameters:
      expression - the UnaryExpression.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeBinaryExpression

      public void writeBinaryExpression​(remodel.expr.BinaryExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of a binary expression. If this involves String operands, writes a special case involving Java String methods. If the operator is exponent, writes a special case using Math methods. Otherwise, writes the Java translation of the left operand, the binary operator, and the right operand.
      Specified by:
      writeBinaryExpression in interface remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor
      Parameters:
      expression - the BinaryExpression.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeAssignmentExpression

      public void writeAssignmentExpression​(remodel.expr.AssignmentExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of an assignment expression. This case is only seen in property updating rules, "object.property := newValue" in which the left-hand operand of the AssignmentExpression is expected to be a (property) InvocationExpression. The kind of initialisation assignment is handled elsewhere.
      Specified by:
      writeAssignmentExpression in interface remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor
      Parameters:
      expression - the AssignmentExpression.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeCompoundExpression

      public void writeCompoundExpression​(remodel.expr.CompoundExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of a compound expression. In ReMoDeL, a sequence of expressions has a result, which is the last expression. Any prior expressions are executed only for their side-effect. Uses the static utility method evalSeq(Object... statements).
      Specified by:
      writeCompoundExpression in interface remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor
      Parameters:
      expression - the CompoundExpression.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeBracketedExpression

      public void writeBracketedExpression​(remodel.expr.BracketedExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of a bracketed expression. Writes the opening parenthesis '(' followed by the Java translation of the wrapped expression, followed by the closing parenthesis ')'.
      Specified by:
      writeBracketedExpression in interface remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor
      Parameters:
      expression - the BracketedExpression.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeLambdaExpression

      public void writeLambdaExpression​(remodel.expr.LambdaExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of a lambda expression. If the result type is "boolean", writes an anonymous subclass of Predicate, and if not, writes an anonymous subclass of Function, with the lambda variable as its argument. Writes a bespoke redefined apply() method, whose body is the lambda expression-body.
      Specified by:
      writeLambdaExpression in interface remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor
      Parameters:
      expression - the LambdaExpression.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeConditionalExpression

      public void writeConditionalExpression​(remodel.expr.ConditionalExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of an if-then-else expression. This is translated as a ternary conditional expression, since the value of the whole expression may be passed as a result. The whole ternary expression is enclosed in parentheses, to avoid problems with Java's associativity rules, when down-casting the type of the result. (If not enclosed, a type downcast applies to the test-expression).
      Specified by:
      writeConditionalExpression in interface remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor
      Parameters:
      expression - the ConditionalExpression.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeCreationExpression

      public void writeCreationExpression​(remodel.expr.CreationExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of a concept creation expression. Writes the Java for a default constructor call for the result type, followed by concatenated setter-invocations for each property assigned within the creation expression. The generated code relies on the fact that each setter-method returns "this" as the result.
      Specified by:
      writeCreationExpression in interface remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor
      Parameters:
      expression - the CreationExpression.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeInvocationExpression

      public void writeInvocationExpression​(remodel.expr.InvocationExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of a property invocation. This could be a property access, or an operation invocation. Property access is translated as a getter-method and operation invocation is translated as a method invocation, followed by the translation of the argument list (which may be empty). Some special operations are translated as prefix functions (supplied in remodel.util.Top), to allow Java parametric types to be inferred correctly.
      Specified by:
      writeInvocationExpression in interface remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor
      Parameters:
      expression - the InvocationExpression.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeApplicationExpression

      public void writeApplicationExpression​(remodel.expr.ApplicationExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of a rule application. Writes the name of the applied rule, followed by the translation of the argument list (which may not be empty).
      Specified by:
      writeApplicationExpression in interface remodel.io.ExpressionVisitor
      Parameters:
      expression - the ApplicationExpression.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeReturnExpression

      public void writeReturnExpression​(remodel.expr.Expression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes any Expression that is marked as the return-value.
      Parameters:
      expression - an Expression, to be returned.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeReturnCompound

      public void writeReturnCompound​(remodel.expr.CompoundExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of a CompoundExpression result. Writes every statement but the last for its side-effect and recursively treats the last statement as a value to be returned.
      Parameters:
      expression - a CompoundExpression result.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.

    • writeReturnConditional

      public void writeReturnConditional​(remodel.expr.ConditionalExpression expression) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the Java translation of a ConditionalExpression result. Writes the if-keyword and the bracketed test-expression in the usual way and recursively treats the then-expression and else-expression as values to be returned.
      Parameters:
      expression - a ConditionalExpression.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an output fault occurs.
